Subjective: Sore throat x 3 days. Fever this AM. Painful swallowing, unbearable. Started with cough last week, now resolved. Took paracetamol/ibuprofen. Friend had abscess, concerned about needing antibiotics. No shortness of breath, no runny nose. Able to swallow liquids but painful. Impact on daily life: unable to play tennis due to fatigue (implied from previous symptom description, though not explicitly stated for current symptoms).
Objective: Vitals: Temp 38.3 C. O2 Sat 98%. Ears: Left TM clear, air-filled. Right ear canal slightly red, otherwise normal. Neck: Small, non-pathological submandibular lymph nodes. Throat: Median uvula, slightly red pharyngeal arch, slightly enlarged tonsils with bilateral slough. No kissing tonsils. Lungs: Vesicular breath sounds, no adventitious sounds.
Assessment: Viral pharyngitis. No signs of bacterial tonsillitis or abscess. Fever noted.
Plan:
1. Explanation: Viral infection, antibiotics not indicated. Symptoms will resolve with time.
2. Pain management: Continue paracetamol (max 4x/day) and ibuprofen (max 3x/day, 400mg). Cold drinks/popsicles for throat pain.
3. Hydration: Drink plenty of fluids.
4. Safety netting: Return if develops shortness of breath, inability to swallow, or significantly worsens.
5. Follow-up: As needed.
